messages.content:
I didn’t see this coming. For 50 years, I was a proud member of the Labour Party as an MP and campaigner.
But now I've joined the Liberal Democrats.
It wasn’t an easy decision to make - I'm leaving behind friends in the Labour Party and it hurts. But it’s the right choice. I can’t stay in a party that has abandoned so many of its core values.
I was appalled by the abject failure of Labour leaders to take the lead in the Brexit referendum. Labour was uniquely qualified to take on the falsehoods peddled by the Leave campaign on the NHS and much else beside.
But to see Labour leaders then sign up to Brexit alongside Conservative and UKIP MPs was the final straw. In doing so they rejected the principles of internationalism held dear by Labour for decades.
Britain needs a party who will stand up for the values that Labour has left behind.
That party is the Liberal Democrats. They have been consistent on Europe, just as they were in their opposition to the war in Iraq and on civil liberties.
They are the party that offers young people hope on the key issues of the day. From Europe to globalisation and climate change, the Lib Dems are the voice of sanity and reason.
Please do give the Lib Dems your active support.
Best wishes,
Bob Marshall-Andrews
PS This election could change Britain for generations - vote for a better future and use your vote to back the Liberal Democrats.
